comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
From the Commonwealth War Graves Commission website:

Name:NEWMAN, NEVILLE
Initials:N
Nationality:United Kingdom
Rank:Second Lieutenant
Regiment/Service:Highland Light Infantry
Unit Text:10th/11th Bn.
Age:21
Date of Death:28/06/1916
Additional information:Son of the late Levy and Mary Newman, of Glasgow.
Casualty Type:Commonwealth War Dead
Grave/Memorial Reference:IV. A. 24.
Cemetery:VERMELLES BRITISH CEMETERY

comment.author: 69704094@N03
comment._content:
From the ‘Highland Light  Infantry Chronicle’, Vol. XVI, No.4, October 1916, p.148
Officer casualties
killed in action
2nd. Lieut. N. Newman – reported 5th July 1916.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
10th (Service) and 11th (Service) Battalions HLI amalgamated in 46th Brigade in 15th (Scottish) Division on 14th May 1916 as 10/11 Battalion HLI, [11th moving from 28th Brigade in 9th (Scottish) Division and dividing to provide troops to the 10th and 12th Battalions HLI so forming 10/11 Bn and 12/11 Bn].  

There was evidently some action near Vermelles on 28 June 1916 as casualties suggest 9 R Dublin Fusiliers (2Lt B Reid); 6 Camerons; 9 Black Watch; Royal Scots (Lt Robert Appleby); and 8 Gordons (Pte Thomas Prentice) were all involved.  Further suggesting 9th, 15th and 16th Divs.  The papers of Capt Charles Weld MC, (Leinster Rifles?), wounded on 28 Jun 1916, held by the IWM may reveal more.//

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
freeBMD
Only birth record of a Neville Newman I could find is registered 1st qr 1895 district Chorlton 8c 916 in the county of Lancashire, England, not Glasgow, Scotland .
Then S Newman, his brother, would likely be Samuel Newman 1st qr 1894 in Chorlton 8c 884.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Dates in 5677 [Jewish calendar date] June 1, 1916 - May 31, 1917 European War War Necrology August - Lieutenant Neville Newman p.277 of American Jewish Year Book www.ajcarchives.org/AJC_DATA/Files/1917_1918_4_YearReview... Lieutenant Neville Newman's name appearing under War Necrology August 1916 I think is understandable wrt to his actual late June 1916 death date; one definition of necrology is "list of persons recently dead". I could not find any records for parents Levy or Mary Newman except probable death date of Mary Newman age 44, burial date 06-Dec-1907 Eastern Necropolis/Janefield Cemetery / Jewish section Glasgow / Scotland in Jewish records. (One-year-old NEIMAN/NEWMAN, Saul / Solomon burial date 04-Nov-1898 is in the same cemetery, Jewish section.) data.jewishgen.org/wconnect/wc.dll?jg~jgsearch~model2~[jowbr]j_Scotland

comment.author: 76068274@N07
comment._content:
The brother was Stanley Newman, Neville's younger brother
Mary was 36 in the Scottish Census of 1901
Neville was born in Manchester
Few surviving relatives, England and Australia

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: Neville Newman born circa 1895 in Manchester, registered in Chorlton. In 1891 the family had been living in Chorlton-on-Medlock where Russian-born Levy (place of birth Curland - Courland? en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Courland#Courland_as_part_of_Russia) now a naturalised British citizen, was a Dealer in Fine Arts. They lived at 146 Rumford Street and had 2 other children: Horace aged 1 and Freeda under 1 month. They employed a Monthly Nurse and a Domestic Servant. By 1901 the family had relocated to Glasgow and were living at 38 Park Road maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.r_qf.... Neville and his brother Horace had been joined by Stanley, Joseph and 2-month old Mabel. No sign of Freeda. Levi [sic] described himself as a Fine Art Commercial Traveller and gave his birthplace as England. National Probate records state Levy Newman of 1 West Bank Quadrant, Glasgow, Lanarkshire maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&sugexp=les;&cp=19&... died 17 September 1915 at 148 Abbey Road, Middlesex maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&sugexp=les;&pq=westban.... Administration London 9 October to Horace Bochmer [sic] Newman commercial traveller £321. (A family tree on www.ancestry.co.uk shows Horace Bohmer Newman died in Sydney, Australia in 1968). There is a note about Neville Newman's death in Jacqueline Gill, 'World War One Soldiers' Records at Kew', Shemot [Journal of the Jewish Genealogical Society of Great Britain], vol. 6, no. 2, June 1998, p. 12 re Lt Neville Newman, Highland Light Infantry, killed 28 June 1916.
